channel.title: Home on scarbrough-trx@GitHub
channel.description: Recent content in Home on scarbrough-trx@GitHub

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Michael, and my professional background is in .NET software engineering (C#, MVC, MSSQL, etc), though this is within the context of an ecosystem of other technologies related to deployment, version control, distribution and testing. Aside from that, I do have some expertise with the Linux operating system (mostly variants of Debian and openSUSE), which I have been using since ~2005. After several years working for the public sector, where I provided technical support for secure communications networks, I decided to take this in a more academic direction, studying computer security at the University of South Wales, and managing to earn a Masters’ degree in 2014.

item.title: My Projects
item.description: Multi-Function Terminal Essentially this is a custom Web browser application based on the latest .NET Framework and WebView2, but it is configurable by the persons administrating the terminal and is designed to run on remotely-managed client machines. Technical Debt and Legacy Software Essentially making sure that software is more secure, robust, maintainable and documented. Wake On LAN Portal This is a Web portal that enables members of an organisation to wake on-premise computers, so they become accessible over Remote Desktop.

item.title: Useful Links
item.description: Codemanship Blog Codemanship’s Blog Babel This is a JavaScript compiler and translator. Could be useful for generating backwards-compatible code. Babel JavaScript Compiler GitHub Commands Cheat Sheet All the commonly-used GitHub commands. GitHub Commands Cheat Sheet Hacker News Technology-related news items and blog posts that might be of interest. Hacker News Netlify Integrate Web site hosting with DevOps and GitHub. Also provides ready-made static site generator templates. Netlify OWASP Top Ten Open Web Application Security Project’s list of top application vulnerabilities and recommendations.
